chapter.title: Known Issues
chapter.para:
1.To destroy snapshots one needs to unmount the snapshots if they are mounted and then they can be destroyed using the command zfs destroy snap_name.
2.When the snapshot is mounted, even if we destroy the snapshot and after that we try to destroy the pool the pool does not gets destroyed. The error message which is seen is " the pool is busy ".
3.Stressing the read/write code paths by having multiple reads and writers to the same file can cause an oops. We are working on this problem and plan to refresh the beta as soon as we have a fix.
4.Access contents of the snapshots through the /pool-or-fs-mntpt/.zfs/snapshot/snapname interface only i.e. they are automounted into that directory. Although manual mounting of the snapshots is possible but there are some complications if the snapshot is mounted manually and also accessed automatically simultaneously.
5.Some properties do not work when set during creation of the zfs file-systems. It is recommended that the user first creates the file-system and then set the desired properties using "zfs set" command.
6.There are some known bugs when exporting the zpool or zfs file-system using the /etc/exports file and mounting it on client machines using nfs.
7.zfs send/receive feature has some known bugs.
